text: 330ml bottle from the Cider Tap, Euston. Sparkling pale yellow-gold colour, short-lived white foam head and aroma of tangy apple & pear, some funk. Taste is mellow pear, some oak, wood, bittersweet, toffee & caramel notes, slight barnyard and tart drying tannin. Slightly oily mouthfeel, light to medium bodied, fine carbonation, dry sourish lightly tannic finish. Quite drinkable.

Bottle at WWT Slimbridge. Straw coloured and sparkling with a rim of white bubbles. Sweet acidic pear aroma. The taste is sweet with tart pear flavour. Plsantly fzzy and refreshing. A lovely summer thirst quencher.

V25 c2 Bottle, from brewers own stall at the Thame Food Festival. Very pale greenish gold with a beautiful light sparkle in the mouth. Sweet pears up front with just the right amount of lemon sharpness and cider vinegar sourness to balance. Dances lightly across the tongue leaving a refreshing fruitiness behind. Lovely- wanted more. An excellent perry.
Light yellow of color. An aroma of perry, dusty and fruity. A flavor of sweets, perry and dry.

Bottle from Millets Farm Shop, Oxon, consumed . This was sold as  Severn Cider Blakeney Red Perry   had this Sun 18th Sept 11    Pours light gold, pears on the nose with a dab of vinegar sharpness though  not so in the mouth. This is sweet but its also quite juicy and the sweetness is very good and not overly sweet, soft in the mouth easy drinking perry, its lovely.  A6 A4 T7 P3 Ov13  3.3

Bottle.  Very pale straw-colored pour. The aroma is moderately sweet with a lovely sweet spicy pear skin character. Quite ripe tasting with a kiss of ripe apple flavour. A touch of acetone fruitiness but its restrained enough to be pleasant. Lovely stuff.

Bottle, courtesy of fonefan. Its a clear one, pale golden to yellow in color and with some white bubbles on top. The aroma reminds me more of a cider than a perry. Some barnyardish notes. The flavor is much the same, more evident on pears. Dry, slightly astringent and medium bodied. Lasting, mouth puckering, drying finish. A quite pleasant one, very dry and quite quenching. 110129

Bottle 500ml. [ As Severn Sider Cider Blakeney Red Perry ].Clear light yellow color initial with a small, fizzy, virtually none lacing, fully diminishing, white head. Aroma is moderate pear, barnyard notes. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a average to long duration, pear, sweet pear, tart pear. Body is light to medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. [20110129]

Bottle 500ml @ fonefan
Pours almost clear as water. Aroma has notes of pears. Taste is medium sweet and light sour. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.
Bottle @ Ulfborg Weekend, Jan 2011. Pours cloudy yellow with a small bubbles on top. Sweet nose and flavor. A bit sticky and cloying. Prickling alcohol. Fresh and crisp finish with a nice tartness.

Bottle 50 cl. Courtesy of fonefan. Pours a clear pale yellow with a rough white head. Sweet fruity nose - more appley actually. Medium body, sweet clean pear notes that turn somewhat astringent towards the finish. Nice alright. 290111
